pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.11: According to Sp.2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc. may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.12: Phalāphale. See PED, s.v. ā⁴.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13: Uttaribhaṅga. According to Vin-vn-ṭ.1907 this is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa.
